title: OTA Offers Free Bitcoins For Each Reservation
text:
Last updated: 04:00 PM ET, Mon July 06 2015 OTA Offers Free Bitcoins For Each Reservation 
Be ready to get acquainted with Bitcoin when making reservation with Hotelgo24.com. The new online travel agency startup is offering up to 5 percent cash back of this new currency type for each booking. YOU MAY ALSO LIKE Running Full Speed Towards Happiness Shannon Wolf 
The international booking service, which features more than 130,000 total accommodations in 20,426 cities across 198 countries, is taking advantage of the craze over the peer-to-peer payment system. 
The system, which has been fairly controversial due to its disruptive nature and security concerns, uses cryptocurrency, which is exchanged between parties without a middleman like a bank. Some scoff at it. Some swear by it. 
But one thing is clear: Bitcoin has entered the mainstream as of late, with Bitcoin ATMs even popping up throughout the world, from Los Angeles to Tel Aviv to Rome. 
Itâ€™s safe to say that Hotelgo24.com is a fan. 
Booking a room through Hotelgo24.com is fairly straightforward and simple, using the traditional format most OTAs feature. After completing the reservation, a confirmation email is sent to the user. Payment can be made via credit card. 
Registration is not required to use the service, but you must register to receive Bitcoins. According to a press release, Bitcoin cash back is sent within seven days of guest checkout from the booked hotel. The amount of Bitcoin cash back that a client will receive depends on the reservation value and Bitcoin exchange rate on the day of booking (as of this writing, one Bitcoin equals $272.51). 
For more information, visit www.Hotelgo24.com .
